stories.text:
I‘m studying Software Engineering and also do a lot of freelance work. Since now, everything went fine side by side. The new project I got offered would interfere with my studies, in a way that I‘d need 1 semester more.

Would you do the project or focus on studying?
stories.title: Would you take that project or finish your studies?

stories.text:
Sandbox Banking (YC W17)| Software Engineers | Full-Time | Remote | https://sandboxbanking.com/careers/

Sandbox provides Banking as a Service (BaaS) infrastructure for fintechs and banks. We help institutions quickly and securely integrate new software. We are growing quickly, YC backed, and possess an enviable runway. Our team is looking to hire exceptional individuals for the following:

Solution Delivery Engineer (https://sandboxbanking.com/2021/04/30/solution-delivery-software-engineer/) Will scope requirements, develop, test and deploy specific customer integrations using our Glyue platform

Platform Software Engineer ( https://sandboxbanking.com/2021/04/30/platform-software-engineer/) Will help build/extend our core SaaS product (Glyue). Our stack is comprised of Vue/JS/HTML/CSS, Python, Django, Postgres, Docker, Terraform, and an assortment of AWS services.

Senior Platform Software Engineer (https://sandboxbanking.com/2021/04/30/senior-platform-software-engineer/ ) Successful candidates will fulfill the requirements of our Platform Software Engineer role and also possess technical leadership, software architecture design, and devops abilities. A minimum of 4 years of professional experience is required.

Solution Delivery Network Engineer (https://sandboxbanking.com/2021/06/11/solution-delivery-infrastructure-engineer/) Will be responsible for quickly delivering, managing, and monitoring the infrastructure and network resources necessary to delight our customers DevOps, aws, ec2, rds, route53, ansible, terraform, openvpn, ipsec experience helpful
stories.title: Sandbox Banking (YC17) is hiring infrastructure and software engineers
They quit. Now they want their jobs back

stories.text:
Have you ever clicked on a Google link to a Reddit page on Safari mobile only to be unable to scroll and prompted to open the Reddit app? This mobile extension may he for you. Created in memory of aaronsw, who almost certainly would have preferred the old Reddit interface.

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/reddo-old-reddit-extension/id1588666191

[working on updated to the ux, a counter in the app of how many times activated, optional history; stoked to get something basic out there I have personally found immensely useful]
stories.title: Show HN: Old Reddit iOS Extension
